eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian, Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: EllipseMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Move objects on ellipses or smoothly back and forth in one direction.
description: It allows objects to move:
- on an ellipsis or arcs
- smoothly vertically or horizontally (by setting one radius to 0)
- on a sine wave (by adding a force)
It can be used for:
- Making objects float, such as powerups or coins
- Moving platforms
- Enemy movement patterns
- Making a player constantly turn right or left ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://star-seeker))

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: SmoothCamera
eventsFunctionsExtensions.previewIconUrl: https://resources.gdevelop-app.com/assets/Icons/Line Hero Pack/Master/SVG/Computers and Hardware/Computers and Hardware_camcoder_gopro_go_pro_camera.svg
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Smoothly scroll to follow an object.
description: The camera follows an object according to:
- a frame rate independent catch-up speed to make the scrolling from smooth to strong
- a maximum speed to do linear following ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://platformer-with-tilemap)) or slow down the camera when teleporting the object
- a follow-free zone to avoid scrolling on small movements
- an offset to see further in one direction
- an extra delay and catch-up speed to give an impression of speed (useful for dash)
- position forecasting and delay to simulate a cameraman response time
A platformer dedicated behavior allows to switch of settings when the character is in air or on the floor. This can be used to stabilize the camera when jumping.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Smoothly scroll to follow an object.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: SmoothCamera

eventsFunctions.description: Move the camera closer to the object.

events.comment:
Delaying and forecasting can be used at the same time.
Forecasting only use the positions that are older than the one used for delaying.
The behavior uses a position history that is split in 2 arrays:
- one for delaying the position (from TimeFromStart to TimeFromStart - CamearDelay)
- one for forecasting the position (from TimeFromStart - CamearDelay to TimeFromStart - CamearDelay - ForecastHistoryDuration

At each frame, the camera must catchup the target by a given ratio (speed)
cameraX(t) - targetX = (cameraX(t - 1) - targetX) * speed

The frame rate must not impact on the catch-up speed, we don't want a speed in ratio per frame but a speed ratio per second, like this:
cameraX(t) - targetX = (cameraX(t - 1s) - targetX) * speed

Ok, but we still need to process each frame, we can use a exponent for this:
cameraX(t) - targetX = (cameraX(t - timeDelta) - targetX) * speed^timeDelta
cameraX(t) = targetX + (cameraX(t - timeDelta) - targetX) * exp(timeDelta * ln(speed))

pow is probably more efficient than precalculated log if the speed is changed continuously but this might be rare enough.

Use the object center when no delay is asked.
Remove history entries that are too old to be useful for delaying and pass it to the history for forecasting.
Don't move the camera if there is not enough history.

Add the extra delay that could be needed to respect the speed limit in waiting mode.

speedRatio = min(speedMaxX / historySpeedX, speedMaxY / historySpeedY)
delay += min(0, timeDelta * (1 - speedRatio))
The time with delay is now between the first 2 indexes

eventsFunctions.description: Update forecasted position. This is called in doStepPreEvents.
eventsFunctions.name: UpdateForecastedPosition

events.comment:
Simple linear regression
y = A * x + B

A = Covariance / VarianceX
B = MeanY - A * MeanX

Note than we could use only one position every N positions to reduce the process time,
but if we really need efficient process JavaScript and circular queues are a must.

VarianceX = sum((X[i] - MeanX)²)
VarianceY = sum((Y[i] - MeanY)²)
Covariance = sum((X[i] - MeanX) * (Y[i] - MeanY))

y = A * x + B

A = Covariance / VarianceX
B = MeanY - A * MeanX
Axis permutation to avoid a ratio between 2 numbers near 0.
Permute back axis

eventsFunctions.description: Project history ends position to have the vector on the line from linear regression. This function is only called by UpdateForecastedPosition.
eventsFunctions.name: ProjectHistoryEnds
eventsFunctions.sentence: Project history oldest: _PARAM2_;_PARAM3_ and newest position: _PARAM4_;_PARAM5_ of _PARAM0_

events.comment:
Perpendicular line:
pA = -1/a; 
pB = -pA * x + y

Intersection:
/ ProjectedY = a * ProjectedX + b
\ ProjectedY = pA * ProjectedX + b

Solution that is cleaned out from indeterminism (like 0 / 0 or infinity / infinity):
ProjectedX= (x + (y - b) * a) / (a² + 1)
ProjectedY = y + (x * a - y + b) / (a² + 1)

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: HedgehogPlatformer
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: This is an extension for 360° movement platformer akin to the Sonic The Hedgehog games.
description: An advanced platformer extension with unique physics made using events that replicate physics from games like Sonic The Hedgehog.
- Features familiar with built-in platformer extension.
- Slope movement system that allows wall running and ceil attachment.
## In comparison to built-in platformer, this extension has:
- Moving along slopes with no slope max angle limits.
- Make players run on ceilings (or bounce off them).
- Increase and/or reduce player speed based on the angle of the ground.
- Allows multiple physic executions per frame, useful to handle collisions at high speeds.
- Checks for wall pushing, under ceilings and on floor.
- 'Draws raycasts of physics' action for debugging.
- Manipulable "Time scale" of physics via action.
## For documentation and usage visit: https://sites.google.com/view/hedgd/home

eventsFunctions.description: Define helper classes JavaScript code.
eventsFunctions.name: DefineHelperClasses

* declare themselves (see PlatformObjectsManager.addPlatform) to the manager
/** Platforms near the object, updated with `_updatePotentialCollidingObjects`.

* Returns all the platforms around the specified object.
* @param {number} maxMovementLength The maximum distance, in pixels, the object is going to do.
// Filter the potential colliding platforms to ensure that the object owning the behavior
// is not considered as colliding with itself, in the case that it also has the
* Returns all the platforms around the specified object.
* @param {number} maxMovementLength The maximum distance, in pixels, the object is going to do.
* @param {gdjs.RuntimeBehavior[]} result An array with all platforms near the object.
// TODO: This would better be done using the object AABB (getAABB), as (`getCenterX`;`getCenterY`) point
// is not necessarily in the middle of the object (for sprites for example).
// Extra check on the platform owner AABB
// TODO: PR https://github.com/4ian/GDevelop/pull/2602 should remove the need
// for this extra check once merged.
// Filter platforms that are not in the searched area anymore.
// This can happen because platforms are not updated in the RBush before that
// It needs to loop as the intersection may be on an inner edge.
// Ensure the source doesn't go passed the target.
// Replace the last raycast step distance with the whole distance.
// Go back a bit to be sure not to miss a close edge.
let sqDistMin = rayX * rayX + rayY * rayY;
const result = object.raycastTest(sourceX, sourceY, targetX, targetY, true);
const dotProduct = rayX * this.normalX + rayY * this.normalY;
* PlatformRuntimeBehavior represents a behavior allowing objects to be
* considered as a platform by objects having PlatformerObject Behavior.
//Note that we can't use getX(), getWidth()... of owner here: The owner is not fully constructed.
if ( sceneManager ) //Remove the object from any old scene manager.
//Make sure the platform is or is not in the platforms manager.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Adds the physics & movements of the hedgehog platformer character (the players or npc's).
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: HedgehogCharacter

events.comment: Avoid bunny jumping
Ignore contradictory inputs

Shearch platforms around the character.
This is done outside of the sub-steps because it's costly and the searched area doesn't need to be precise as long as the character don't move outside of it.
Use sub-steps to avoid collision issues when fps drop.

Whatch overlapping jumpthru to avoid to snap on top of a jumpthru from above.
The raycast conditions automatically ignore the marked jumpthru.
Going up
Going down

eventsFunctions.description: Runs the ground physics on the object
eventsFunctions.name: MoveOnGround
eventsFunctions.sentence: Move the object _PARAM0_ on the ground

events.comment:
The slope factor is not applied when:
- the character is on a ceilling
- the character is stopped unless the slope is steep
Jump

Left and right input on ground (speed capped to top speed)
- When the character is already running at a higher speed than he can possibly achieve on his own, his speed must not be capped.
No input check (friction)
Wall collision separation on ground

Push sensors are 1 pixel outside of the character to avoid ground sensors to detect walls.
When the character is stopped, the old speed values must be cleared to avoid it to move a little.
0.1 is about sin(6°), it checks if the character is facing the wall + or - 12° with a cross product. This avoids to detect a slope as a wall at great speed (particulary in loops).
Speed (ground speed) transformation to horizontal and vertical speeds
Raycast from the center to find the slop angle because it's more stable than toggling between left or right raycast.
Slip
Unattach from ceiling

eventsFunctions.description: Runs the airborne physics on the object
eventsFunctions.name: MoveOnAir

events.comment: Air jump
Jump height reducer

Left and right input on air (horizontal speed capped to top horizontal speed)
- When the character is already flying at a higher speed than he can possibly achieve on his own, his speed must not be capped.

"Where is air drag?"
No input check (air friction)
The gravity is applied after the player position is updated.

Push sensors are 1 pixel outside of the character to avoid ground sensors to detect walls.
When the character is stopped, the old speed values must be cleared to avoid it to move a little.
Flat floor
Slope
Steep slope
Flat ceilling
Steep ceilling

events.comment:
FloorMagnetDistanceMin = 3.75 = 4 pixels / 32 pixels * 30 fps
FloorMagnetDistanceMax = 13.125 = 14 pixels / 32 pixels * 30 fps

These properties are in character height per second because it allows to keep the value relevent no matter the resolution and the frame rate of the game.
This way extension users don't need to worry about it.

parameters: min(abs(GroundSpeed) + FloorMagnetDistanceMin * Height, FloorMagnetDistanceMax * Height) * TimeDelta

eventsFunctions.sentence: The last platform in collision with _PARAM0_ is doing ground angle snapping vertically

eventsFunctions.name: ToggleLayerAccordingToMarker
eventsFunctions.sentence: Toggle collision layer of _PARAM0_ according to the last marker in collision and old position _PARAM2_ ; _PARAM3_

eventsFunctions.description: Mark the last platform in collision as the overlapping jumpthru. The raycast conditions automatically ignore the marked jumpthru.
eventsFunctions.name: SetOverlappingJumpthru
eventsFunctions.sentence: Mark the last platform in collision as the overlapping jumpthru of _PARAM0_

eventsFunctions.description: Check if a jumpthru is marked as the overlapping.
eventsFunctions.name: IsOverlappingJumpthru
eventsFunctions.sentence: A jumpthru is marked as the overlapping _PARAM0_

eventsFunctions.description: Forget the overlapping jumpthru
eventsFunctions.name: ResetOverlappingJumpthru
RaycastClosePlatforms
eventsFunctions.sentence: Cast a ray from _PARAM2_ ; _PARAM3_ to _PARAM4_ ; _PARAM5_ against platforms close to _PARAM0_

eventsFunctions.description: Sends a ray from the given source position to the final point. When the source is inside the platforms, the ray is sent backward and returned distance is negative.
eventsFunctions.name: RaycastClosePlatformsBothWay
eventsFunctions.sentence: Cast a ray from _PARAM2_ ; _PARAM3_ to _PARAM4_ ; _PARAM5_ both ways against platforms close to _PARAM0_ ingoring jumpthru: _PARAM6_

eventsFunctions.description: Sends a ray from the given source position to the final point. When the source is inside the platforms, the ray is sent backward and returned distance is negative.
eventsFunctions.name: RaycastFromCharacter
eventsFunctions.sentence: Cast a ray from _PARAM2_ ; _PARAM3_ toward direction _PARAM4_ ; _PARAM5_ covering at most _PARAM6_ pixels both ways against platforms close to _PARAM0_ ingoring jumpthru: _PARAM7_

parameters: "Sensor: " + ToString(LocalSourceX * CosA - LocalSourceY * SinA) + " " + ToString(LocalSourceX * SinA + LocalSourceY * CosA)

parameters.description: Ray source position X (in local space)
parameters.name: LocalSourceX

parameters.description: Ray source position Y (in local space)
parameters.name: LocalSourceY

parameters.description: Ray direction on local X (-1, 0 or 1)
parameters.name: LocalDirectionUnitX

parameters.description: Ray direction on local Y (-1, 0 or 1)
parameters.name: LocalDirectionUnitY

eventsFunctions.description: the last recast intersection distance.
eventsFunctions.name: RaycastDistance

eventsFunctions.description: Return the last recast intersection position on X axis.
eventsFunctions.name: RaycastIntersectionX

eventsFunctions.description: Return the last recast intersection position on Y axis.
eventsFunctions.name: RaycastIntersectionY

eventsFunctions.description: Return the last recast intersection normal on X axis.
eventsFunctions.name: RaycastNormalX

eventsFunctions.description: Return the last recast intersection normal on X axis.
eventsFunctions.name: RaycastNormalY

eventsFunctions.description: the last intersected platform type by recast.
eventsFunctions.name: RaycastPlatformType
eventsFunctions.sentence: the last intersected platform type by recast

eventsFunctions.description: Mark the last raycasted platform as the current platform
eventsFunctions.name: SetCurrentPlatform
eventsFunctions.sentence: Mark the last raycasted platform as the current platform of _PARAM0_

eventsFunctions.description: Forget the current platform
eventsFunctions.name: ResetCurrentPlatform

eventsFunctions.description: Return the current platform X.
eventsFunctions.name: CurrentPlatformX

eventsFunctions.description: Return the current platform X.
eventsFunctions.name: CurrentPlatformY

eventsFunctions.description: Follow the current platform.
eventsFunctions.name: FollowCurrentPlatform

propertyDescriptors.label: Jump height reducer (0 to 1)
propertyDescriptors.description: Vertical speed is changed by this value when jump input is not received after (or in the middle) of a jump (only works with jump frames).
propertyDescriptors.name: JumpHeightReducer

propertyDescriptors.label: Ceil bounce factor
propertyDescriptors.description: Applies a multiplication on the Y speed when hitting a ceiling (0: Speed loss, 1: No speed loss, +1: Ceil sticking, -0: Ceil bounce).
propertyDescriptors.name: CeilBounceFactor

propertyDescriptors.label: Max speed
propertyDescriptors.description: The maximum speed obtained with input.
propertyDescriptors.name: MaxSpeed

propertyDescriptors.label: Deceleration
propertyDescriptors.description: When changing of direction on the ground.
propertyDescriptors.name: Deceleration

propertyDescriptors.label: Friction
propertyDescriptors.description: When there is no input.
propertyDescriptors.name: Friction

propertyDescriptors.label: Downwards slope factor
propertyDescriptors.description: Speed gain when moving downwards.
propertyDescriptors.name: DownSlopeFactor

propertyDescriptors.label: Upwards slope factor
propertyDescriptors.description: Speed loss when moving upwards.
propertyDescriptors.name: UpSlopeFactor

propertyDescriptors.label: Stand max angle
propertyDescriptors.description: Allow characters to fully stop on not too steep floors.
propertyDescriptors.name: StandMaxAngle

propertyDescriptors.label: Slip duration
propertyDescriptors.description: Time needed for the platformer to regain control after slipping down a slope (0 to deactivate).
propertyDescriptors.name: SlipDuration

propertyDescriptors.label: Min floor magnet distance (in character height per seconds)
propertyDescriptors.description: At low speeds.
propertyDescriptors.name: FloorMagnetDistanceMin

propertyDescriptors.label: Max floor magnet distance (in character height per seconds)
propertyDescriptors.description: At high speeds.
propertyDescriptors.name: FloorMagnetDistanceMax

propertyDescriptors.label: Collision layer
propertyDescriptors.description: Only interacts with platforms of the same layer.
propertyDescriptors.name: CollisionLayer

propertyDescriptors.label: Is grounded
propertyDescriptors.description: The current state of the object (grounded or airbone)
propertyDescriptors.name: IsOnFloor

propertyDescriptors.description: The control lock timer when slipping
propertyDescriptors.name: SlipTimer

propertyDescriptors.description: Used in the "IsMoving" condition
propertyDescriptors.name: OldX

propertyDescriptors.description: Used in the "IsMoving" condition
propertyDescriptors.name: OldY

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Adds the collision of the hedgehog platformer (solid floor, walls and obstacles).
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: HedgehogPlatform

propertyDescriptors.label: Collision layer
propertyDescriptors.description: Only interacts with characters of the same layer.
propertyDescriptors.name: CollisionLayer

propertyDescriptors.label: Snap horizontally
propertyDescriptors.description: Snap movement angle to 0° or 180°.
propertyDescriptors.name: ShouldSnapAngleHorizontally

propertyDescriptors.label: Snap vertically
propertyDescriptors.description: Snap movement angle to 90° or 270°.
propertyDescriptors.name: ShouldSnapAngleVertically

propertyDescriptors.label: Targeted layer
propertyDescriptors.description: The layer given to player on the right or bottom. The marker layer is used for the other side.
propertyDescriptors.name: TargetedCollisionLayer
